Title: Using ETFs for Global Trading

Description:
Steve has been trading global asset classes and market indices since the 1990s. In this talk, he will explain his perspective on asset class investing and how he uses ETFs to trade globally. Steve will also review the development of the quantitative approach that underlies his investment strategies.


Stephen Cucchiaro Bio:

Stephen Cucchiaro is president and founder of Windward Investment Management, Inc. with overall responsibility for investment performance.


Mr. Cucchiaro has conducted over 25 years of research on the global capital markets. He earned a BS in Mathematics at M.I.T. in 1974 and an MBA in Finance at Wharton in 1977, where he was the top student in his graduating class in Investments and Corporate Finance courses. Upon graduation, Mr. Cucchiaro held positions in management consulting with Coopers & Lybrand, Data Resources (as senior economist) and CSP International (now part of Booz-Allen & Hamilton) as managing director of strategy consulting. In 1984, he became president and co-founder of Datext, Inc., which was successfully sold to Lotus Development Corporation in 1987. As general manager at Lotus, his group was responsible for the commercial introduction of Lotus Notes. Subsequently, as president of ICAD, Inc, he helped position this engineering automation software provider for IPO and subsequent sale to Oracle Corporation. In 1990, Mr. Cucchiaro launched his Model of the global capital markets, became an SEC-registered investment advisor and organized the corporation now known as Windward Investment Management, Inc.

During the late 1970?s, Mr. Cucchiaro qualified for the U.S. Olympic Team in yacht racing and became national champion of his class in 1978 and Gold Medalist in the 1979 Pan American Olympic Games.


The agenda for the meetup will be:
7:00 Fred Sears's Q&A, a Market Discussion led by Doug and then Stockpicks led by Mike Kinkead and Chris Jones
8:00 Steve Cucchiaro's feature presentation (described above)

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required.
